intro: Rupicapnos africana subsp. anomala, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa, characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces capsule fruits that contain flat, winged seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warmer climates. Its botanical features make it well-suited for gardens and landscapes in regions with mild winters.
